name: BAPE
name_ja: ア・ベイシング・エイプ
description: Founded by NIGO in the backstreets of Harajuku, A Bathing Ape became the definitive Japanese streetwear brand with its iconic ape head logo and shark hoodies. Now owned by I.T Group, BAPE continues to drive global streetwear culture through bold camo prints and high-profile collaborations.

buy_guide.summary: BAPE is widely available through resale and select international retailers, but Japan-exclusive items require a proxy. Official online store ships domestically only.

best_channels.name: BAPE Official (via Buyee)
best_channels.notes: Full catalog including Japan exclusives, use proxy service

best_channels.name: ZOZOTOWN (via Buyee)
best_channels.notes: Wider range of seasonal items at retail

name: HUMAN MADE
description: NIGO's post-BAPE venture blends vintage Americana aesthetics with Japanese streetwear sensibility. Known for its heart logo, varsity jackets, and collaborations with brands like adidas and Girls Don't Cry, HUMAN MADE channels a nostalgic, handcrafted feel.

buy_guide.summary: Limited international availability. Official store ships Japan-only. Select pieces appear on global retailers during drops.

best_channels.name: HUMAN MADE Official (via proxy)
best_channels.notes: Full range including exclusives, proxy required

name: NEIGHBORHOOD
description: Shinsuke Takizawa's NEIGHBORHOOD draws from military, motorcycle, and workwear aesthetics to create a dark, rugged vision of Tokyo streetwear. A cornerstone of the Ura-Harajuku movement, the brand is known for its skull motifs, MA-1 jackets, and collaborations with WTAPS and adidas.

buy_guide.summary: Available at select global retailers for mainline pieces. Japan-exclusive collaborations require proxy purchasing. Official store is Japan-only.

name: WTAPS
description: Tetsu Nishiyama's WTAPS fuses military precision with streetwear attitude, creating utilitarian garments marked by bold typography and functional details. Alongside NEIGHBORHOOD, WTAPS helped define the militaristic side of Harajuku's streetwear scene.

buy_guide.summary: International availability is limited to select stockists. Japan releases often sell out quickly. Proxy recommended for full access.

name: Wacko Maria
description: Born from the worlds of rockabilly, ska, and classic cinema, Wacko Maria brings a louche, rebellious energy to Japanese streetwear. Co-founded by former J-League footballer Atsuhiko Mori, the brand is celebrated for its Hawaiian shirts, leopard prints, and film-referencing graphics.

buy_guide.summary: Growing international presence but Japan-exclusive pieces still require proxy. Hawaiian shirts are the signature entry point.

name: Comme des Garçons
name_ja: コム・デ・ギャルソン
description: Rei Kawakubo's Comme des Garçons revolutionized global fashion with its anti-fashion philosophy, deconstructed silhouettes, and conceptual runway shows. The brand's main line remains largely Japan-exclusive, while diffusion lines like CDG Play have achieved worldwide commercial success.

buy_guide.summary: CDG Play is widely available globally. Main line and Homme Plus are harder to find outside Japan and Dover Street Market. Use proxy for JP-exclusive releases.

best_channels.name: Dover Street Market
best_channels.notes: Largest CDG stockist outside Japan, US locations

name: Undercover
description: Jun Takahashi's Undercover merges punk rock ethos with high fashion craftsmanship, producing collections that are narrative-driven and visually arresting. From the early Harajuku days to Paris Fashion Week, Undercover remains one of Japan's most consistently innovative labels.

buy_guide.summary: Available at major luxury retailers internationally. Japan store exclusives and collaborations need proxy access.

best_channels.name: Undercover Official (via proxy)
best_channels.notes: Full range, Japan domestic shipping only

name: sacai
description: Chitose Abe's sacai is built on the concept of hybrid garments, splicing unexpected fabrics and silhouettes into cohesive designs. Known for its Nike collaborations and layered aesthetic, sacai has become one of the most commercially successful Japanese avant-garde brands globally.

buy_guide.summary: Strong international retail presence. Nike collaborations sell out instantly. Mainline available at luxury stockists year-round.

name: Yohji Yamamoto
description: A towering figure in fashion history, Yohji Yamamoto's all-black, oversized silhouettes challenged Western beauty standards when he debuted in Paris in 1981. His work across mainline, Y-3 with adidas, and various sub-labels continues to define dark, poetic fashion.

buy_guide.summary: Y-3 is widely available. Pour Homme and mainline pieces are stocked at luxury retailers. Archive pieces command premium resale prices.

best_channels.name: SSENSE
best_channels.notes: Pour Homme and Y-3 lines available

name: Issey Miyake
description: Issey Miyake pioneered the intersection of technology and fashion, with innovations like Pleats Please and A-POC transforming how garments are conceived and produced. The brand continues to push boundaries in textile engineering and wearable art under creative directors carrying forward the founder's legacy.

buy_guide.summary: One of the most internationally accessible Japanese designer brands with its own US retail stores. Pleats Please and BAO BAO lines are widely stocked.

best_channels.name: Issey Miyake Official
best_channels.notes: US online store available, direct shipping

name: visvim
description: Hiroki Nakamura's visvim obsessively researches heritage craftsmanship from around the world, incorporating natural dyes, hand-stitching, and artisanal techniques into Americana-inspired pieces. The brand's FBT moccasins and Christo sandals are icons, and its commitment to craft places it in a category of its own.

buy_guide.summary: visvim operates its own WMV e-commerce internationally but stock is limited. F.I.L. flagship stores in Tokyo carry the full range. Resale market is active for sold-out pieces.

best_channels.name: visvim WMV Official
best_channels.notes: Official e-commerce, limited international shipping on select items

name: Kapital
description: Based in Okayama's denim country, Kapital transforms American workwear and folk traditions into wildly creative garments featuring patchwork, sashiko stitching, and bold indigo dyeing. The Hirata family's three-generation denim legacy makes Kapital one of the most authentically artisanal Japanese brands.

buy_guide.summary: Kapital has limited US stockists but most of the range requires proxy purchasing from Japan. The brand's own online store is comprehensive but ships domestically only.

best_channels.name: Kapital Official (via proxy)
best_channels.notes: Complete catalog, proxy required for international

best_channels.name: ZOZOTOWN (via Buyee)
best_channels.notes: Good selection at Japanese retail prices

name: NEEDLES
description: Keizo Shimizu's NEEDLES, part of the Nepenthes family, is renowned for its track pants with signature butterfly embroidery and its masterful reconstruction of vintage sportswear. The brand's papillon motif has become one of the most recognizable symbols in contemporary fashion.

buy_guide.summary: Relatively accessible through Nepenthes New York and global stockists. Track pants are the signature entry point. Japan stores carry wider range.

best_channels.name: Nepenthes New York
best_channels.notes: Official US retail, full NEEDLES range

name: Engineered Garments
name_ja: エンジニアードガーメンツ
description: Designed by Daiki Suzuki in New York under the Nepenthes umbrella, Engineered Garments applies a Japanese eye for detail to American workwear, military, and Ivy League traditions. The brand is celebrated for its Bedford jacket, Loiter jacket, and meticulous pattern-mixing.

buy_guide.summary: Highly accessible in the US through Nepenthes NY and many authorized retailers. One of the easiest Japanese-designed brands to buy directly.

name: orSlow
description: Ichiro Nakatsu's orSlow produces unhurried, vintage-inspired workwear and denim using carefully sourced fabrics and traditional construction methods. The brand name itself ('or slow') reflects its philosophy of slowing down and appreciating craft over speed.

buy_guide.summary: Growing availability through US and European stockists. Japanese retail offers the widest selection and earliest access to new releases.

name: nanamica
description: Eiichiro Homma's nanamica bridges the gap between urban fashion and outdoor functionality, using GORE-TEX and technical fabrics in clean, city-appropriate silhouettes. As the Japanese licensee for The North Face Purple Label, nanamica also produces one of the most coveted Japan-exclusive collaborations.

buy_guide.summary: nanamica ships internationally from its own online store. The North Face Purple Label remains Japan-exclusive and requires proxy. Mainline is stocked at global retailers.

name: Snow Peak
description: Founded in 1958 as a mountaineering equipment maker in Niigata, Snow Peak evolved into a lifestyle brand encompassing premium camping gear and a sophisticated apparel line. Their clothing brings the same obsessive quality and functional design to everyday urban wear.

buy_guide.summary: Snow Peak has US retail operations including a Portland headquarters and US online store. Most apparel is accessible directly without proxy.

best_channels.name: Snow Peak USA
best_channels.notes: US online store with direct shipping

name: and wander
description: Founded by former Issey Miyake designers Keita Ikeuchi and Mihoko Mori, and wander brings a fashion-forward sensibility to outdoor clothing. Their pieces balance technical performance with an aesthetic refinement rarely seen in the outdoor category.

buy_guide.summary: Growing global presence through select stockists. Japan store has widest range. Technical outerwear pieces are the standout category.

name: Goldwin
description: Goldwin is Japan's foremost technical performance apparel company, holding Japanese licenses for The North Face and Helly Hansen while developing its own premium Goldwin label. Their in-house line showcases cutting-edge Japanese textile technology in minimalist, high-performance designs.

buy_guide.summary: The Goldwin own-label line is primarily available in Japan. Some pieces appear on international stockists. The North Face Japan exclusives require proxy.

best_channels.name: Goldwin Official (via proxy)
best_channels.notes: Full Goldwin label range, Japan only

name: Descente ALLTERRAIN
name_ja: デサント オルテライン
description: Descente ALLTERRAIN represents the pinnacle of Japanese technical outerwear, combining Descente's decades of sportswear expertise with futuristic design and premium materials. Their seamless down jackets and Schematech construction exemplify Japan's leadership in functional fashion innovation.

buy_guide.summary: Limited international distribution. Japan stores and online carry the full range. The Mountaineer and Anchor down jackets are standout pieces.

best_channels.name: ZOZOTOWN (via Buyee)
best_channels.notes: Wider range at Japan retail prices

name: Momotaro Jeans
description: Part of the Japan Blue Group, Momotaro Jeans produces premium selvedge denim in Okayama's Kojima district, the birthplace of Japanese jeans. Named after the folk hero Momotaro, the brand is known for its distinctive pink selvedge line, battle stripes, and exceptional fabric development.

buy_guide.summary: Well-distributed internationally through denim specialty retailers. US stockists carry a solid range. Okayama factory store has exclusive models.

name: Pure Blue Japan
name_ja: ピュアブルージャパン
description: Pure Blue Japan is revered among denim enthusiasts for its use of natural indigo dyeing, slubby textures, and hand-woven selvedge fabrics. Based in Okayama, the brand produces some of the most characterful raw denim in the world, with each pair developing unique fade patterns.

buy_guide.summary: Available through dedicated denim retailers internationally. Natural indigo pieces command premium prices. Japan retail offers earliest access and exclusive fabrics.

name: Iron Heart
description: Iron Heart is synonymous with heavyweight denim, producing jeans in fabrics up to 25oz that are engineered for motorcyclists and anyone who demands extreme durability. Founded by Shinichi Haraki, the brand has cultivated a devoted global following through its uncompromising approach to construction.

buy_guide.summary: Iron Heart has established international distribution through its own overseas web stores. Self-Edge is the key US partner. Community-driven brand with active forums.

best_channels.name: Self Edge
best_channels.notes: Key US stockist with exclusive models

name: Samurai Jeans
description: Samurai Jeans is a purist's denim brand, creating faithful reproductions of vintage American jeans using proprietary looms and fabrics. Based in Osaka, founder Yoshiyuki Nogami's dedication to historical accuracy and heavy-duty construction has earned Samurai a cult status among denim collectors.

buy_guide.summary: Limited international distribution. Best purchased through Japan-based denim retailers that ship internationally. Zero series and S710 are iconic models.

best_channels.name: Denimio
best_channels.notes: Best international source, tax-free from Japan

name: Studio D'Artisan
name_ja: ステュディオ・ダ・ルチザン
description: As one of the original five Osaka denim brands (alongside Evisu, Denime, Full Count, and Warehouse), Studio D'Artisan has been producing premium Japanese denim since 1979. Their pig mascot logo and commitment to vintage reproduction techniques make them a cornerstone of the Japanese denim movement.

buy_guide.summary: Available through denim specialty retailers internationally. One of the most historically important Japanese denim brands. The D1 and SD-108 are classic models.

best_channels.name: Denimio
best_channels.notes: Wide range, ships from Japan tax-free

name: BEAMS
description: Japan's premier select shop, BEAMS has shaped Japanese fashion culture since 1976 through its expertly curated mix of international and domestic brands alongside strong in-house labels. With sub-labels like BEAMS Plus (Americana), BEAMS T, and International Gallery BEAMS, it functions as both retailer and tastemaker.

buy_guide.summary: BEAMS Plus has US retail presence. Main BEAMS stores are Japan-only. ZOZOTOWN carries extensive BEAMS inventory accessible via proxy.

best_channels.name: BEAMS Official (via proxy)
best_channels.notes: Full range of all sub-labels, Japan only

best_channels.name: ZOZOTOWN (via Buyee)
best_channels.notes: Extensive BEAMS inventory at retail prices

name: United Arrows
name_ja: ユナイテッドアローズ
description: United Arrows occupies the upscale tier of Japan's select shop ecosystem, curating sophisticated international brands alongside refined in-house labels. Sub-labels like Beauty & Youth and Monkey Time cater to different demographics, while the mainline maintains an elevated, business-casual aesthetic.

buy_guide.summary: Primarily a Japan domestic retailer. Online store and physical shops carry a massive range. Best accessed through proxy or ZOZOTOWN via Buyee.

name: SHIPS
description: One of Japan's original select shops alongside BEAMS and United Arrows, SHIPS has maintained a classic, preppy-leaning identity since 1977. The brand curates a mix of traditional and contemporary styles with an emphasis on quality basics and timeless American and European influences.

buy_guide.summary: Japan-only retail with no direct international shipping. ZOZOTOWN is the best proxy-accessible source for SHIPS items.

name: Journal Standard
name_ja: ジャーナルスタンダード
description: Part of the BAYCREWS retail group, Journal Standard offers a casual, approachable take on French and American-influenced fashion. The brand serves as an accessible entry point into Japan's select shop culture with reasonable pricing and trend-aware curation.

buy_guide.summary: Japan-only retail brand. Accessible via ZOZOTOWN proxy. In-house items offer great value for the quality.

name: Nano Universe
description: Part of TSI Holdings, Nano Universe provides fashionable, affordable clothing with a European-influenced aesthetic. It occupies a similar space to UNIQLO but with more trend-forward designs, making it popular among young professionals in Japan.

buy_guide.summary: Japan domestic only. Low-cost entry point for Japanese fashion via proxy services. Great for basics and affordable trend pieces.

name: Junya Watanabe
name_ja: ジュンヤ ワタナベ
description: Operating under the Comme des Garcons umbrella, Junya Watanabe is celebrated for his technical mastery of patchwork, fabric reconstruction, and collaborations with heritage brands like Levi's, Carhartt, and The North Face. His menswear line (Junya Watanabe MAN) has become a pillar of wearable avant-garde fashion.

buy_guide.summary: Available at major luxury retailers globally. MAN line is more accessible than womenswear. Heritage brand collaborations are highly sought after.

name: Comme des Garçons Homme Plus
name_ja: コム・デ・ギャルソン・オム・プリュス
description: Comme des Garcons Homme Plus is Rei Kawakubo's primary menswear runway line, showcasing the most conceptual and avant-garde expressions of her vision. Each season presents a new thematic world, from punk to baroque, making it one of fashion's most anticipated presentations.

buy_guide.summary: Stocked at Dover Street Market and high-end boutiques globally. Japan retail has the widest selection. Archive pieces are highly collectible.

name: Maison Mihara Yasuhiro
name_ja: メゾン ミハラヤスヒロ
description: Mihara Yasuhiro made his name with conceptual footwear that deconstructs and reimagines classic shoe silhouettes, particularly his signature dissolved sneakers. His full ready-to-wear line carries the same playful, subversive approach to fashion conventions.

buy_guide.summary: Growing international availability, especially for footwear. The Peterson sneakers have driven global recognition. Full clothing range mainly in Japan.

name: AMBUSH
description: Co-founded by designer YOON and musician VERBAL, AMBUSH began as a jewelry label before expanding into bold, statement-making ready-to-wear. YOON's appointment as Dior Men's jewelry designer cemented the brand's position at the intersection of street culture and high fashion.

buy_guide.summary: Good international availability through the brand's own e-commerce and luxury retailers. Jewelry and accessories are the entry point.

name: FACETASM
description: Hiromichi Ochiai's FACETASM is a collision of streetwear energy and avant-garde construction, known for bold color blocking, oversized silhouettes, and unexpected fabric combinations. Ochiai's background in both Comme des Garcons and streetwear culture creates a uniquely hybridized aesthetic.

buy_guide.summary: Limited international retail presence. Japan stores and select global stockists carry seasonal pieces. Growing recognition after LVMH Prize nomination.

name: White Mountaineering
name_ja: ホワイトマウンテニアリング
description: Yosuke Aizawa's White Mountaineering applies a fashion lens to outdoor clothing, creating technically proficient garments that work equally well on city streets and mountain trails. The brand's collaborations with adidas and Moncler have expanded its reach significantly.

buy_guide.summary: Available at select international retailers. Japan retail carries the widest range. adidas collaborations are the most accessible entry point.

name: Cav Empt
description: Created by Sk8thing (graphic designer for BAPE and Billionaire Boys Club) and Toby Feltwell, Cav Empt produces graphic-heavy, dystopian streetwear with a tech-futurist edge. The brand's cryptic graphics, digital prints, and oversized shapes have made it a favorite of the post-streetwear generation.

buy_guide.summary: Drops sell out quickly on the official store. International stockists carry limited selections. The graphic pieces are the brand's signature.

name: N.HOOLYWOOD
description: Daisuke Obana's N.HOOLYWOOD draws deeply from vintage military and Americana archives, reinterpreting historical garments with a Japanese precision and contemporary edge. Named after North Hollywood, the brand has shown at New York Fashion Week and maintains a loyal following among vintage enthusiasts.

buy_guide.summary: Limited international distribution. Japan retail carries the full range. The COMPILE and TEST PRODUCT lines offer different price points.

name: Porter / Yoshida & Co.
name_ja: ポーター / 吉田カバン
description: Founded in 1962 by Kichizo Yoshida, Porter (by Yoshida & Co.) is Japan's most revered bag maker, producing meticulously crafted bags and accessories in their Tokyo workshops. The Tanker series, inspired by military flight jackets, is one of the most iconic bag designs ever created.

buy_guide.summary: Porter International handles some overseas distribution, but Japan carries the full range including collaboration pieces. The Tanker and Heat lines are the most popular.

name: SOPHNET. / SOPH.
description: Hirofumi Kiyonaga's SOPHNET. represents the clean, refined end of Japanese streetwear, producing well-made basics and wardrobe staples with subtle design flourishes. The brand's understated approach and consistent quality have made it a quiet staple of Tokyo's fashion-conscious dressers.

buy_guide.summary: Primarily Japan-only distribution. ZOZOTOWN is the best proxy-accessible source. Collaborations with Nike and uniform experiment are the most sought-after pieces.

name: Uniform Experiment
name_ja: ユニフォーム エクスペリメント
description: A collaborative label between Hirofumi Kiyonaga's SOPH. and Hiroshi Fujiwara's Fragment Design, Uniform Experiment merges minimalist streetwear with Fujiwara's legendary tastemaking. The brand produces refined, wearable pieces that embody Tokyo's understated cool.

buy_guide.summary: Japan-only distribution. Highly sought after due to Hiroshi Fujiwara connection. Proxy services required for international purchase.

name: Toga
description: Yasuko Furuta's Toga explores themes of femininity and deconstruction through unexpected material combinations, metal hardware, and Western-meets-punk aesthetics. The Toga Virilis menswear line extends her distinctive design language into bold, gender-fluid territory.

buy_guide.summary: Available at select global retailers. Toga Archives line is the most widely stocked. Japan retail carries the complete range.

name: Fumito Ganryu
name_ja: フミト ガンリュウ
description: After departing Comme des Garcons where he led the Ganryu line, Fumito Ganryu launched his own label focused on technical daily wear that bridges functionality and design. His collections emphasize innovative fabrics and practical silhouettes for urban living.

buy_guide.summary: Emerging brand with growing stockist network. Available at forward-thinking boutiques globally. The CDG pedigree brings instant credibility.

name: Auralee
description: Ryota Iwai's Auralee has quickly become a favorite among minimalist fashion enthusiasts for its obsessive focus on fabric quality. Each piece begins with custom-developed textiles, resulting in elevated basics that feel extraordinary through material innovation rather than design complexity.

buy_guide.summary: Growing international presence but still primarily Japan-focused. The brand's premium basics command a dedicated following. Fabrics are the primary selling point.

name: COMOLI
description: Nobuaki Komori's COMOLI produces understated, impeccably crafted menswear with a focus on natural fabrics and relaxed silhouettes. The brand's extremely limited distribution and word-of-mouth following have created a near-mythical status among Japanese fashion insiders.

buy_guide.summary: Extremely limited distribution even within Japan. No international stockists. Items sell out rapidly from the few authorized retailers. Patience and proxy services are essential.

best_channels.name: COMOLI Official (via proxy)
best_channels.notes: Very limited stock, sells out quickly

name: kolor
description: Junichi Abe's kolor is built on the interplay of unexpected colors, textures, and materials, creating intellectually stimulating garments that reward close examination. Part of the Comme des Garcons retail family, kolor occupies a unique space between commercial wearability and design experimentation.

buy_guide.summary: Available at select high-end retailers globally. Dover Street Market is the key international stockist. Japan retail carries the full range.

name: Suicoke
description: Suicoke transformed the technical sandal from outdoor utility into a fashion statement, with their Vibram-soled MOTO and DEPA models becoming ubiquitous in streetwear and high fashion circles. Collaborations with Mastermind, BAPE, and Needles have cemented their crossover appeal.

buy_guide.summary: Widely available internationally through the brand's own e-commerce and numerous stockists. One of the most accessible Japanese fashion brands globally.

name: Hender Scheme
description: Ryo Kashiwazaki's Hender Scheme produces handcrafted leather goods in Tokyo, most famously their 'Hommage' series which recreates iconic sneaker silhouettes in natural vegetable-tanned leather. Every piece is designed to age beautifully, developing a unique patina with wear.

buy_guide.summary: Available at select high-end retailers globally. The MIP (Manual Industrial Products) sneaker line is the signature entry point. Japan retail carries the widest range.

name: Sasquatchfabrix.
name_ja: サスクワァッチファブリックス
description: Daisuke Yokoyama's Sasquatchfabrix. reinterprets traditional Japanese motifs and garment construction through a contemporary streetwear lens. Featuring elements like noragis, happi coats, and ukiyo-e prints alongside Western silhouettes, the brand creates a distinct East-meets-West fusion.

buy_guide.summary: Limited international distribution. Japan stores carry the full range. The Japanese-motif pieces are the brand's most distinctive offering.

name: HYKE
description: Founded by Hideaki Yoshihara and Yukiko Ode, HYKE produces refined, minimalist womenswear that emphasizes clean lines, quality fabrics, and understated elegance. Their collaborations with The North Face and adidas have introduced a performance edge to their traditionally restrained aesthetic.

buy_guide.summary: Primarily Japan-only distribution. The North Face collaborations generate the most international demand. Proxy required for most purchases.
